bibl.title: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Henry Rose Carter, January 16, 1924

div1.p: Russell writes that he would like Carter to meet Balfour.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Henry Rose Carter, January 16, 1924

CABLE ADDRESS “INTERCOM”
January 16, 1924.
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
Doctor Andrew Balfour, who has been the Director of the
Wellcome Research Laboratories in Khartum and later of the Wellcome
Bureau of Scientific Research in London, and who has recently been
selected to be the Director of the new London School of Hygiene
and Tropical Medicine, and who is probably known to you, will be
in Washington with me on Sunday, January 27. I should like very
much, if it is proper and if you desire it, to bring him up to
see you early Sunday evening or late Sunday afternoon. We shall
stop at the Cosmos Club, and hope to arrive there sometime Sunday
morning. We are leaving New York on Sunday, January 20, to visit
some public health activities in the South.
div1.closer:
Yours very sincerely, F F Russell Doctor H. R. Carter,
2121 California Street, N.W.
Washington, D. C.
